direct_answer.text: First Side Time (FST): FST=5 min; Second Sides Time (SaT) SaT=(FST*2)=(5*2)=10min per side so combined it’s 2*(10)*Minutes^2=20 Minutes ^2 ; Third Sides Times (TaSt) TaSt=(FST*2)=(5*2)=10mins/side so combined its 2*(10)^Minutes^2+2^(10)^Minutes^2; Last Two Sides time (LaST) LaST=(FST)/2=((5)/2); Total Cube Time or TCT would therefore equal FST+(SaT)+(TaSt)+(LaST), which equals  5+20+20+(5/2). First, let's breakdown the information we know into discrete parts regarding the complexity level associated with every single aspect being discussed hereabout; these can also serve as indicators pertaining our subject matter under examination – namely 'Rubix cube'.

Condition   | Complexity Level          | Duration Required   
-------------------------------|------------------|----------     
Side 1       | Low                         | 5 mins              
Side 2 &     | Higher            | Doubled From Side 1=1x*2sec
Side 3        | **Total**           | Same As Side 2&3+Side 1(Highest)=2+2 sec Each            
Side 4 &     | Lower              | Half Of Any Section=1/2*(Any Single Section)'sTimeEach               
Side 5 &     | Equal To Prior Steps    | No Change Detected Here! Hence It Becomes Similar To PREVIOUS Step Which Is Not Explicit But Implied That All Are Completed !!! :)!!!
Final Side Sixth (Implied)| Maximum Given Earlier Descriptions And Following Logical Inducements Based Upon Previous Descriptive Data Point

0.user_question: Given a list of conditions, please answer the question. Condition 1:  For one portion (side) of solving the Rubik’s Cube, it takes John exactly 5 minutes. Condition 2: Sides two and three require double this time compared to condition 1. Condition 3: Both the fourth and fifth sides demand only half the duration needed for any given section according to condition 1. Conclusion: Once John completes the final or sixth side, which was already implied but not stated explicitly because "all" implies completion., calculate his entire solution timespan. Answer comprehensively listing down separate timings before adding up to find the total solve time required for the complete puzzle using logical reasoning based on provided data without assuming prior knowledge about standard cubic solvetime norms. Total Time = Calculation_Answer
